page.title: 02Housing in Denbeath
page.content: The Wemyss Coal Company built houses in various styles. The main workforce lived in back-to-back,two-storeyed houses with outside stairs to the houses above. These houses,which fell derelict in the seventies and which are now being renovated by a private development company with Government aid,are in a triangular block with its base in Forth Street and its apex in Don Street.Single-storey terraced blocks were built in Barncraig Street,Bow Street, Wall Street and Den Street. Semi-detached villas were provided for officials in Kenmore Terrace and Wellesley Crescent. In the seventies,modern bungalows were built by Kirkcaldy District Council on the West side of Ward Street.
